creatorScripts.title: Anti-Polyester Attack
creatorScripts.creator: Aaron or Dalton
creatorScripts.script:
Look, I'm not gonna tell you what to wear. But I will show you what your shirt is actually made of.

[holds up polyester shirt]

This... this is plastic. Like, actual plastic from fossil fuels. 62% polyester means 62% of this came from an oil refinery.

I started thinking about this when my wife and I were trying to have a kid. Started looking into all the stuff touching my body 16 hours a day.

Turns out there's studies â€” real studies, not internet stuff â€” showing microplastics in places they really shouldn't be.

[cut to demonstration]

This is what hemp can take. Watch.

[flame test or knife test]

Still here. Because plants don't melt.

I'm not saying throw away everything you own. I'm just saying... maybe think about what's against your skin all day.

Link's in bio if you wanna see what we're doing different.
hooks: Your shirt is 62% plastic. Here's what that means.
I stopped wearing polyester when my wife and I couldn't get pregnant.
Watch what happens when I hit this $40 shirt with a blowtorch.
creatorScripts.notes: Use real competitor percentage (Cuts = 62%). Cite studies naturally, not as attack.

creatorScripts.title: Durability Focus
creatorScripts.creator: Aaron
creatorScripts.script:
Okay so people keep asking how strong this fabric actually is.

Fair question. Let me show you.

[pulls out bow and arrow / BB gun / knife]

This is a $40 tee. Same one I've worn like 200 times.

[test happens]

...yeah. That's hemp. 4x stronger than cotton.

Most shirts I bought before this, they'd last maybe a year? If I was lucky? Then the collar stretches, the fabric thins out, you're buying another one.

This thing comes with a lifetime guarantee because they know it's not gonna fail.

I've had it for [X months] now. Still looks the same as day one.

That's not marketing. That's just... hemp.
hooks: I shot my shirt with a BB gun. Here's what happened.
This is the last shirt you'll ever need to buy.
Watch me try to destroy a $40 tee.
creatorScripts.notes: Pure demo format. Let the destruction speak. Keep voiceover casual.

creatorScripts.title: Airflow/Breathability
creatorScripts.creator: Josh or Growthpod
creatorScripts.script:
So I used to think all shirts were basically the same when it came to sweating.

Like, you work out, you sweat, your shirt gets gross. That's just how it is, right?

Turns out that's a fabric problem.

Polyester traps heat because plastic doesn't breathe. Cotton absorbs everything and just... holds it.

This has 31% bamboo in it. And bamboo has these tiny gaps in the fiber that let air actually move through.

[fog machine test or just movement]

I wore this thing for a full day in Florida. 90 degrees. Still didn't smell.

That's not me bragging about my hygiene. That's the bamboo doing its job.

I don't really think about my shirts anymore. That's the whole point.
hooks: Why does your shirt smell after 2 hours?
I wore this for 72 hours straight. Here's what happened.
The reason you sweat through your shirt isn't you.
creatorScripts.notes: Casual, relatable. Don't oversell â€” let the benefit be discovered.

creatorScripts.title: Health Focus
creatorScripts.creator: Dr. Chris or Dalton
creatorScripts.script:
Alright so I need to tell you about something that's been bothering me.

There's a study from 2024 â€” Zhang et al, if you wanna look it up â€” that found microplastics in human testes.

Not in rats. In humans.

And a separate study found them in semen.

Now I'm not saying your polyester shirt is the only source. Microplastics are everywhere â€” water, air, food.

But polyester fabric sheds thousands of these particles every time you wear it. Every time you wash it.

And that fabric is against your skin. Absorbing into your body. All day.

I switched to hemp and bamboo about a year ago. Zero plastic, zero PFAS, zero microplastics.

I can't undo what's already happened. But I can control what I put on my body going forward.

Researchers are still figuring out what this all means. I just decided I didn't want to wait to find out.
hooks: They found microplastics in human reproductive organs. Here's what I did.
The clothing industry doesn't want you to know this.
A 2024 study changed how I think about my clothes.
creatorScripts.notes: MUST cite studies properly. Never claim health outcomes. Use 'researchers found' language.

creatorScripts.title: Out of the Box - Laundry Test
creatorScripts.creator: Aaron or new creator
creatorScripts.script:
I'm gonna do something kinda stupid.

This is the same shirt I've washed... [counts]... probably 150 times? Maybe more.

And this is a brand new one from the same batch.

[holds both up side by side]

Can you tell which is which?

Most people can't.

That's the whole point. Hemp doesn't break down like cotton. It doesn't pill like polyester. It doesn't stretch out or fade or thin out at the collar.

I used to buy like 5 black tees a year because they'd all fall apart. Now I have 3 of these and I'm set.

$120 once. Not $100 every year forever.

The math just... works.
hooks: This shirt has been washed 150 times. Can you tell?
I stopped buying t-shirts. Here's why.
Side by side: 1 year old vs brand new. Guess which is which.
creatorScripts.notes: Visual proof of durability claim. Simple, undeniable.

creatorScripts.title: NEVER DONE BEFORE - Ice Test
creatorScripts.creator: Aaron
creatorScripts.script:
Nobody's done this before.

[holds up ice pack and two shirts]

I'm gonna wrap this ice in polyester. And this one in our hemp blend.

[time lapse setup]

Polyester traps temperature. Hot or cold, it holds it against your skin.

Hemp and bamboo regulate. They breathe.

[reveal after X minutes]

Look at the difference.

This is why you feel hot in polyester even when it's not that warm out. The fabric is working against you.

I never really thought about this until someone explained it to me. Now I can't un-know it.

Natural fibers were the standard for thousands of years. We switched to plastic because it was cheaper. Not because it was better.
hooks: I froze my shirt. Here's what I learned.
Polyester vs Hemp: temperature test nobody's tried.
Why you sweat in polyester even when it's cold.
creatorScripts.notes: New demo concept. Proves temperature regulation visually.

editorConcepts.title: Founder Story - The Pivot
textOverlay: We spent 3 years building the perfect shirt.
Then we started trying to have a kid.
Because some things matter more than profit.
hooks: We threw away 3 years of work. Here's why.
The $300k mistake that changed everything.
My fertility journey led to this shirt.

editorConcepts.concept: Left: guy in polyester having issues. Right: guy in UndrDog thriving. Same scenarios.
scenes: Morning: polyester guy scratchy/uncomfortable vs UD guy comfortable
Workout: polyester soaked vs UD dry
After work: polyester smelly vs UD fresh
6 months later: polyester falling apart vs UD still perfect
1 year later: buying new shirts vs same 3 shirts
hooks: Two guys. Same day. Different shirt.
The difference a fabric makes.
Left: $15 shirt. Right: $40 shirt. Watch what happens.

newDemos.concept: Polyester melts/sparks in microwave. Hemp stays intact.
newDemos.why: Visual proof that polyester is plastic

newDemos.name: UV Light Microplastic Test
newDemos.concept: Use UV light to show microplastic shedding from polyester
newDemos.equipment: UV flashlight, dark room, both fabrics

newDemos.name: Static Cling Test
newDemos.concept: Polyester sticks to everything. Hemp doesn't.

demosToRedo.name: Flamethrower V2
demosToRedo.improvements: Shoot at dusk for dramatic fire glow, multiple angles, slow-mo

demosToRedo.name: Fog Test V2
demosToRedo.original: Concept was good but visibility was poor
demosToRedo.improvements: Better fog machine, backlit for airflow visibility, tighter shot
demosToRedo.location: Dark room with single light source behind fabric

outOfBoxIdeas: TIME CAPSULE: Bury a shirt, dig it up in 6 months. Hemp intact, polyester degraded.
MAKER COLLAB: Send shirt to blacksmith/welder/mechanic. See what it survives at their job.
ANIMAL TEST: Horse/dog can't chew through it (supervised, safe).
FREEZE TEST: Freeze shirt overnight, flex immediately. Hemp survives, polyester cracks.
ROAD TRIP: Same shirt for 7-day road trip. Day by day updates. Still fresh at end.

rules: Do NOT mention competitor brand names in ads
No health claims outside approved list â€” use 'researchers found' language
Never be the expert â€” share what studies say, cite sources
Microplastics come from many sources â€” polyester adds to exposure, isn't the only source

approvedHealthClaims.title: Polyester & Male Fertility
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Polyester underwear linked to reduced sperm count
approvedHealthClaims.citation: A 1992 study by Shafik found that polyester underwear was associated with reduced sperm production.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics in Human Testes
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Microplastics detected in human testicular tissue
approvedHealthClaims.citation: A 2024 study by Zhang et al found microplastics present in human testicular tissue.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics in Human Semen
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Microplastic particles found in human semen samples
approvedHealthClaims.citation: Zhao et al (2024) detected microplastic particles in human semen samples.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics & Testosterone (mice)
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Microplastic exposure associated with testosterone changes in mice
approvedHealthClaims.citation: A 2024 study in MDPI Toxics showed microplastic exposure was associated with testosterone changes in animal models.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics in Human Brain
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Microplastics detected in human brain tissue
approvedHealthClaims.citation: Bindo et al (2025) published in Nature Medicine found microplastics in human brain tissue.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics & Cardiovascular Disease
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Association between microplastics and cardiovascular outcomes
approvedHealthClaims.citation: Marfella et al (2024) found associations between microplastics and cardiovascular disease markers.

approvedHealthClaims.title: Microplastics in Human Penile Tissue
approvedHealthClaims.finding: Microplastics found in human penile tissue
approvedHealthClaims.citation: Yu et al (2024) detected microplastics in human penile tissue samples.
